newsitem.title: UK: UK's ITV to screen Liverpool European soccer ties.
newsitem.headline: UK's ITV to screen Liverpool European soccer ties.

text.p: ITV has secured live television rights to both legs of Liverpool's European Cup Winners' Cup soccer semifinal with Paris St Germain, the UK commercial network said on Thursday.
The first leg from the French capital is on April 10, the night after ITV broadcasts Manchester United's Champions' League semifinal first leg against Borussia Dortmund of Germany.

"We felt that the presence of England's top two clubs in European semifinals allowed us to break our own rules by showing live soccer on consecutive nights," said Jeff Farmer, head of sports production at ITV.
ITV can screen another soccer double header when the return legs are played on April 23 and 24.
ITV has the rights to the Champions' League until 2000 and did a one-off deal with Liverpool and Paris St Germain to secure the rights to their semifinal.

Farmer said ITV had an audience of 11.5 million for Manchester United's Champions' League quarter-final first leg with Porto earlier this month, won 4-0 by the English club. The second leg attracted an audience of over 10 million.
